channel.title: Comments on: Google Wave Invitations
channel.description: Amit Schreiber's Blog | הבלוג של עמית שרייבר

item.title: By: Amit
item.dc:creator: Amit
item.description: Andy: That's pretty impressive. Never heard of ShowDocument.com until now. Thanks
item.content:encoded: Andy: That’s pretty impressive. Never heard of ShowDocument.com until now. Thanks

item.title: By: andy
item.dc:creator: andy
item.description: Online collaborating and teaching can work, If you have trust and the right tools. I recently tried http://www.showdocument.com/ - good app for uploading documents and working on them in real-time. Most file types are supported and it needs no installation. - andy
item.content:encoded:
Online collaborating and teaching can work, If you have trust and the right tools.
I recently tried http://www.showdocument.com/ – good app for uploading documents and working on them in real-time.
Most file types are supported and it needs no installation. – andy

item.title: By: Amit
item.dc:creator: Amit
item.description:
That's an interesting question. When asked about Wave I always say that while it's a "technical wonder" I have no idea how it will end up as a product.
I will say, though, that with some friends of mine Wave has proven to be a useful collaboration tool even in its simplest discussion form (no plugins/gadgets/robots/whatever)
item.content:encoded:
That’s an interesting question. When asked about Wave I always say that while it’s a “technical wonder” I have no idea how it will end up as a product.

I will say, though, that with some friends of mine Wave has proven to be a useful collaboration tool even in its simplest discussion form (no plugins/gadgets/robots/whatever)

item.title: By: Itai Tzur
item.dc:creator: Itai Tzur
item.description:
It's interesting to observe how invitations that went for hundreds of dollars on ebay only a few weeks ago, have almost no demand now.
Could this be Google's next big flop?
item.content:encoded:
It’s interesting to observe how invitations that went for hundreds of dollars on ebay only a few weeks ago, have almost no demand now.

Could this be Google’s next big flop?

item.title: By: Amit
item.dc:creator: Amit
item.description: :) Right... shows how good I am in marketing
item.content:encoded: :) Right… shows how good I am in marketing
